intro: Operculina turpethum var. ventricosa, commonly known as the Indian breadfruit or wild breadfruit, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has traditional uses in local medicine and as a food source.
